body_html:
I just tested with the master branch and got the same error. I confirmed that the testonly = 1 flag has been removed, so there might be another issue.

I did find another fix, though. Adding the bazel option --spawn_strategy=standalone solves the problem for me. It worked when I compiled inside a Docker container, and it also worked when compiling on a native linux box.

And in case it's relevant, I should also mention that I'm not compiling tensorflow itself, but rather compiling a C++ app that has tensorflow as a dependency, and this app is in a separate folder and links to tensorflow in the WORKSPACE file.
body_text:
I just tested with the master branch and got the same error. I confirmed that the testonly = 1 flag has been removed, so there might be another issue.
I did find another fix, though. Adding the bazel option --spawn_strategy=standalone  solves the problem for me. It worked when I compiled inside a Docker container, and it also worked when compiling on a native linux box.
And in case it's relevant, I should also mention that I'm not compiling tensorflow itself, but rather compiling a C++ app that has tensorflow as a dependency, and this app is in a separate folder and links to tensorflow in the WORKSPACE file.
body:
I just tested with the master branch and got the same error. I confirmed that the `testonly = 1` flag has been removed, so there might be another issue.

I did find another fix, though. Adding the bazel option `--spawn_strategy=standalone`  solves the problem for me. It worked when I compiled inside a Docker container, and it also worked when compiling on a native linux box. 

And in case it's relevant, I should also mention that I'm not compiling tensorflow itself, but rather compiling a C++ app that has tensorflow as a dependency, and this app is in a separate folder and links to tensorflow in the WORKSPACE file.
